law.catch_line: Judicial circuits with two Circuit Judges and two numbered divisions.
law.text:
The following judicial circuits are entitled to two (2) judges and shall have two (2) numbered divisions of the Circuit Court:
Fourth Judicial Circuit.
Fifth Judicial Circuit.
Sixth Judicial Circuit.
Tenth Judicial Circuit.
Eleventh Judicial Circuit.
Twelfth Judicial Circuit.
Thirteenth Judicial Circuit.
Eighteenth Judicial Circuit.
Twentieth Judicial Circuit.
Twenty-first Judicial Circuit.
Twenty-fourth Judicial Circuit.
Thirty-second Judicial Circuit.
Thirty-fourth Judicial Circuit.
Thirty-seventh Judicial Circuit.
Thirty-eighth Judicial Circuit.
Thirty-ninth Judicial Circuit.
Forty-first Judicial Circuit.
Forty-second Judicial Circuit.
Forty-third Judicial Circuit.
Forty-sixth Judicial Circuit.
Forty-ninth Judicial Circuit.
Fiftieth Judicial Circuit.
Fifty-first Judicial Circuit.
Fifty-third Judicial Circuit.
Fifty-fifth Judicial Circuit.
Fifty-seventh Judicial Circuit.
law.history: Amended 2006 Ky. Acts. ch. 250, Pt. V, sec. 1, effective January 1, 2007. -- Amended 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 173, Pt. XIII, 1.(3), sec. 1, effective July 15, 2006. -- Amended 2003 Ky. Acts ch. 66, sec. 4, effective June 24, 2003. -- Amended 2001 Ky. Acts ch. 72, sec. 2, effective June 21, 2001. -- Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 541, sec. 1, effective July 1, 2000. -- Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 517, sec. 3 and 12, effective September 1, 1998, January 1, 1999, and September 1, 1999. -- Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 204, sec. 2, effective October 1, 1996; and ch. 377, sec. 2, effective October 1, 1996. -- Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 356, sec. 1, effective July 14, 1992. -- Amended 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 247, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1980. -- Created 1976 (1st Extra. Sess.) Ky. Acts ch. 14, sec. 478.

metadata.lrc-note: (1/1/2007). 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 250, Pt. V, sec. 6, provides that the new judgeships created by subsections (1), (16), (21), and (26) of this statute shall become effective January 1, 2007.
